title: Is it dicencourage or discourage? Could you use both? - Quora

response.answer_text: Discourage is what's commonly used. You can use discourage in regard to yourself or to others. You can say, “I was discouraged”, or if talking to another person, “I don't want to discourage you…” Disencourage sounds more like a word you would use in regard to other people though. However I've never heard this word used often, and never heard anyone say it really. e.g. “I don't want to disencourage you”, this would not sound natural imo. I would just stick with “discourage”.
